newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch state to sell stake in KNSF.
newsitem.headline: Dutch state to sell stake in KNSF.

text.p: The Dutch state said on Monday it was planning to sell its stake in former explosives company Koninklijke Nederlandsche Springstoffenfabriek NV (KNSF).
KNSF is listed on the Amsterdam stock exchange and has become a property fund.

Koninklijke Nederlandsche Springstoffenfabrieken NV, the Dutch state and investment fund General Investment Fund NV have agreed that the state will sell its 50 percent stake in KNSF for 7,500 guilders per share to GIF, the statement said.
Other shareholders are invited by General Investment Fund to sell their shares for the same price.
General Investment Fund said it wanted to continue the listing of KNSF.
